results.title: Jubilee
results.brief_description: Queen Elizabeth I is transported by her astrologer into the latter part of the 20th century, and is appalled by what she sees in this punk rock era. Outrageous dissection of modern urban life, full of black jokes, it has the right attitudes but is not free of a determination to shock at all costs.

results.title: Kagemusha
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Toho Kabushiki Kaisha and TCF
results.brief_description: Kagemusha means “The double”, and refers to the practice used by Japanese warlords of employing others to impersonate themselves during battles. In this film, a thief about to be executed is reprieved and given the task of impersonating one such man. When the latter dies, the impersonation continues, until he is unmasked, whereupon the story moves on to explore the end of a warrior clan. An impressive, lavish work. Also known as “The double” or “Shadow warrior”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Akira Kurosawa, Toho Kabushiki Kaisha and TCF

results.title: Hail Mary = Je Vous salue Marie
results.creator_credit: Jean-Luc Godard, Channel 4, Television Romande and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: This amazingly moving, funny yet disturbing, richly human film has aroused passionate feelings right around the world. Mary, the young daughter of a petrol station owner who is just beginning to discover womanhood, and her taxi driver, Joseph, try to grapple with her unexplained pregnancy.

results.title: Cartouche = Swords of Blood
results.creator_credit: Philippe De Broca, Georges Dancigers, VIDES Cinematografica, Filmsonor and Ariane
results.brief_description: Jean-Paul Belmondo is a good-hearted thief operating in 18th century Paris. He teams up with Venus, a gipsy pickpocket (Claudia Cardinale), overthrows the leader of the pickpocket gang (Marcel Dalio) and turns it into a crime syndicate that gives the fancy baubles of the rich to the poor. “Cartouche” encompasses tragedy, farce and violence in a popular, high-flown adventure.

results.title: The Night the Prowler
results.creator_credit: Jim Sharman, Anthony Buckley, New South Wales Film Corporation and Chariot Films
results.brief_description: This story begins as a comedy surrounding the reactions of the Bannisters to an alleged attack on their daughter, Felicity. From this point on, Felicity embarks on an odyssey of self-discovery. Adapted by Nobel prize-winning author, Patrick White, from his own short story. Stars John Derum, Maggie Kirkpatrick and Terry Camilleri.

results.title: Merry Christmas Mr Lawrence
results.creator_credit: Nagisa Oshima, Jeremy Thomas and Recorded Picture Company
results.brief_description: Set in a Japanese prisoner-of-war camp towards the end of World War II, the story subtly explores the bonds that develop between men in stressful situations; bonds that often transcend culture and inexplicably, sometimes, even transcend the barriers between captor and captive. Based on a novel by Sir Laurens Van Der Post. Stars David Bowie, Tom Conti, Jack Thompson and Ryuichi Sakamoto Takeshi.

results.title: Radio days
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: I love old radio stories, and I know a million of them. I’ve collected them down through the years like a hobby. Anecdotes, gossip and inside stories about the stars. Plus I recall so many personal experiences, from when I grew up, listening to show after show. Now it’s all gone, except for the memories. Let Woody Allen take you back to the golden era of the radio days. Linking a number of colourful radio stories with a delightful look at his own childhood, the writer-director recreates a lost era. Discover the Masked Avengers horrible secret! See how a beautiful blonde cigarette girl goes on to find stardom! And how some burglars win the star prize on radio “Guess that tune” for their unsuspecting victims!! Allen’s ensemble of actors includes Mia Farrow, Diane Keaton, Julie Kavner and Dianne Wiest.

results.title: The Empty Beach
results.creator_credit: Chris Thomson, John Edwards, Timothy Read and Jethro Films
results.brief_description: Bryan Brown is Cliff Hardy, private investigator, in “The Empty Beach”, a powerful Australian crime thriller based on the novel by Peter Corris. It begins as a routine investigation into a supposed drowning. But Hardy soon found himself running for his life in the seedy, violent underworld of Sydney’s playground, Bondi. An involving journey into the corrupt underworld of Sydney, “The Empty Beach” also stars Anna Maria Monticelli, Ray Barrett, Nick Tate and Belinda Giblin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Thomson, John Edwards, Timothy Read and Jethro Films

results.title: The Informer
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Cliff Reid and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: John Ford’s motion picture masterpiece is about a dull witted lout who sells out his best friend, an IRA leader, for a twenty pound note, and then is overwhelmed by the consequence of his act. Based on the novel by Liam O’Flaherty. Stars Victor McLaglen.

results.title: The Fourth man = de Vierde Man
results.creator_credit: Paul Verhoeven, Rob Houwer and Verenigde Nedelandsche Filmcompagnie
results.brief_description: The Fourth Man is a supernatural erotic thriller with strong reminders of the work of directors such as De Palma, Bergman, Roeg, Bunuel and Hitchcock. The plot revolves around Gerard Reve, a writer noted for his inability to distinguish fiction from reality - who travels from Amsterdam to lecture to a rather provincial literary circle in a nearby town. He accepts an invitation to spend the night with a beautiful, rich widow. Reve’s voyeuristic attachment to the widow aided by his runaway imagination, leads him to the discovery of the widow’s mysterious past. Dubbed in English.
